before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"3put","text":"As we use commercial sperm straws to perform our extractions, we do not always know the composition of these straws, the quantity of material contained, the nature of the diluents and preservatives used. This is why it is sometimes necessary to use several straws to obtain enough material for sequencing. It is also sometimes wise to perform several washes (see step 3) to eliminate contaminants from diluents and preservatives.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

creator.name: Cecile Grohs

description: {"blocks":[{"key":"a39dd","text":"Here we describe a routine method for isolate DNA from different kinds of tissues: commercially available frozen semen straws, blood, ear biopsies, or other tissues.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cv64t","text":"\nThis protocol is based on a salting-out method and uses several commercially available solutions.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4q880","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"caabc","text":"It consists of several steps: washing of samples, lysis, removal of proteins and precipitation of genomic DNA. This protocol was used to isolate hundredsod samples for years.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"1r6os","text":"For recovering DNA from blood, use  K3-EDTA tubes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4kn6b","text":"Salting out is a good method to obtain DNA, as it avoids using phenol/chloroform and allows to recover DNA from different qualities of blood.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
